bill.title: Atomic Veterans Healthcare Parity Act

committee.name: Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs.

item.latestTitle: Mark Takai Atomic Veterans Healthcare Parity Act

item.text:
Atomic Veterans Healthcare Parity Act

This bill includes veterans who participated in the cleanup of Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands during the period January 1, 1977-December 31, 1980, as radiation exposed veterans for purposes of the Department of Veterans Affairs presumption of service-connection for specified cancers.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. TAKAI:H.R. 3870.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section VIII of the United States Constitution[Page H7390]

item.title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the treatment of veterans who participated in the cleanup of Enewetak Atoll as radiation exposed veterans for purposes of the presumption of service-connection of certain disabilities by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs.

item.name: Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs Subcommittee

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
